column1: The Merlock Mountains are mentioned in the The Shire-poem The Mewlips.
It is unknown if the Merlock Mountains refer to an actual mountain range in Middle-earth
column2: or if they were just an invention by the poet. As the poem describes a location similar to Mirkwood
column5: the" it is possible that they were a fictitious version of the Misty Mountains
column6: or what the Hobbits knew about them.

column1: Tolkien fandom have speculated that the name Merlock was inspired by the name Morlock appearing in Tolkiens earlier poem "Knocking at the Door" (which was perhaps itself inspired by Wikipedia:H. G. Wellss Wikipedia:Morlock)
